doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Barend de Vries held on June 28, 1990
doc.abstracts: On June 28, 1990, Barend de Vries was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Olivier. During his tenure at the Bank from 1955 to 1984, Mr. de Vries worked in the following areas: in the western hemisphere department as a senior economist (1955-1959) and as an economic advisor (1963-1965); in the economic department as deputy director (1965-1967) and as senior advisor (1967-1970); as chief economist in the western Africa region (1970-1974) and in the Latin America and Caribbean (LAC) region (1974-1977); in the industrial development and finance department as an industrial policy advisor (1977-1982); and as policy and research advisor in both the industry department (1982-1983) and in the energy and industry staff department (1983-1984). His transcript concerns his work in Latin America, particularly Nicaragua and Brazil, his work with a consultative group for Ghana, and the ability of the World Bank to provide technical assistance to countries whose large projects were a very essential contribution of the World Bank.
